Item.Value: Stone/Stone, for building things
Arcane Essence/Holds a spark of magic
Wood/Wood, it builds stuff
Cotton Cloth/Soft cloth made from the finest picked cotton.
Peat/Saying it smells earthy is a kindness.
Potion Base/You basically can't make potions without it.
Darkwood Lumber/A piece of swamp wood, you can almost feel the power radiating off of i-oh, OH! what is that SMELL?!
Linen Cloth/A fabric used to make typical clothing.
Song Bottle/An enchanted bottle holding a magical song.
Poppet/A doll imbued with an animate spirit
Fanged Fur/The shed fur of a fanged fur.
Imp Essence/The swirling essence of a troublesome imp.
Blue Feather/A bright feather from a bird.
Flame Mote/A small fragment of elemental fire.
Enchanted Seed/A small seed glowing with potential.
Swamp Muck/A dollop of swamp muck from a Muck Dweller
Magical Leaf/An enchanted leaf bestowed with power
Mushroom Powder/Powdered mushrooms... better not take too much.
Echo of Joy/Joy given form
Echo of Sorrow/Echoes of a long lost pain
Echo of Rage/An echo of a long ago wrong.
Silver Leaf/Used in potions
Mage Bell/A small flower sought out for it's magical properties
Tiny Mushroom/Useful as a base for powders and unguents. Don't take too much though.
Sprig of Lavender/A sprig of fresh lavender, used in various alchemical creations.
Flax Fiber/The fibers of a Flax plant, used to spin into textiles
Cotton Boll/Soft cotton used for fabric
Black Thistle/Rumor has it that a single prick fromt his thistle can cause an endless torpor
Winter Berry/Rumors says that this berry was first grown by the Spirits to help the villagers during the first Winter in the hollow.
Potion Berry/A berry with helpful healing properites commonly used in potions.
Silkworm Cocoon/Cocoon of the silkworm, used to make silk.
Dragon Fiber/The fibers of the Dragonleaf plant.

Diamond/A bright, shining diamond
Emerald/A brilliant emerald
Ruby/A blazing red gem
Sapphire/A bright blue stone
Opal/A scintillating stone
Jet/A dull black stone
Amber/A gemstone of hardened sap. There appears to be something inside of it.
Jade/A stone sought after for it'smystical properties
Amethyst/A purple gemstone
Topaz/A warm, yellowgemstone used for healing.
Smelling Salts/Wake Up
Antidote/Cures Poisons
Poisoned Knife/Inflicts Poison
Silk Cloth/Luxurious fabric coveted by the higher classes.
Dragonweave Cloth/A luxuriously soft, magical cloth highly sought after by magic users.
Token of Mirth/A jade token from the spirits blessing the bearer with mirth
Key/Unlocks
Griselda's Orb/General Use
Wooden Wand/A basic wand
Copper Wand/A magical wand
Divining Wand/A wand used by seers to help them predict the future.
Black Night/This wand was enchanted with the essences of many dark creatures, giving it a sinister power.
Thunderstorm/These crackling wands were first created during the largest thunderstorm in three centuries.
Will of the Archmage/Only the most puissant of Wizards can hope to channel the powerful energies that course through this wand.
Acolyte's Staff/A staff for trainee healers
Coiled Staff/A carefully worked staff that twists and coils
Emerald Staff/A carven staff topped with an emerald
Winter's Blessing/A powerful staff enchanted with the chill winds of winter.
Glass Orb/An orb made of glass
Copper Orb/A magical orb made of polished copper
Gazing Orb/An orb of polished steel set with a bright Sapphire.
Ruby Rose/These stones were first popularized by a trio of sisters that defended the Western Woods.
Light of Inspiration/A polished golden orb which holds the magical accomplishments of countless Summoners within its polished depths.
Ancient Orb/This orb holds within it whispers and echoes of an ancient time, held in amber and boundi nmythril.
Songsphere/A collaborative effort between Bards and Summoners, these magical stones resonate with music and are often used to create a gentle atmosphere in upper class locales.
Serpent's Eye/Jade polished and imbued with the ferocity of a dragon. Some way that these orbs grant the wielder a powerful affinity for dragons.
Spring's Promise/Infused withmagical herbs and reagents, this orb has been blessed by the spirits of spring and always smells faintly of lavender.

Eye of Eternity/Only the purest Diamond and Adamantine can be used to make this orb. The first such orb was said to have been blessed by the spirits that dwell beyond our world, granting it's wielder insight into worlds beyond our own.
